summary:
Interests in Spatial Planning and Decision Support Systems and Infrastructures (SPDSSI) are:
- Institutionalization of planning support for settlement synergies in regional economic development with UN-Habitat
- Development of collaborative methods, techniques and tools, conflict analysis and management.
- Online spatial planning and decision support
- Institutionalizing of SPDSSI
- Integrated assessment and (deep) uncertainty/risk in spatial planning and decision making e.g. management adaptation to climate change
- domains of urban development, forestry, agriculture, integrated natural/water resources management.

What makes me tick:
- Improving the practice of spatial and economic development in developing countries
- Methods of decision making and spatial planning and decision making 
- Integrated Assessment and interdisciplinary work
- Development of low and middle-income countries
- Technology in society
- Teaching the experience of practice

Memberships: 
- Spatial Decision Support Consortium 
- International Society of City and Regional Planners (ISOCARP)

treasury_media.title: Nominated teacher of the year 2019-2020.
treasury_media.description: Thanks to all students for participating in this election! Wonderful to be nominated. After 20 years of teaching, teaching has become more challenging because how to teach experience? Years of contract research and education all over the world has been of value beyond description. I aim to "practice what I preach" and "preach what I practice". I hope students recognize this and appreciate a lightness of the joy of science. Due to all auditing, they have less fun then I had in my studies.

profile_positions.company: Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC) of the University of Twente
profile_positions.description:
Current and recent R&D projects:
2020 - 2025: Settlement Synergies. Contract research through UN-Habitat projects about the Spatial Development Framework Method for regional spatial and economic development in African countries. Read: https://doi.org/10.1080/13563475.2019.1658571 and https://doi.org/10.1080/13563475.2019.1657809. 

Software development
2014 - 2018: MaMaSe "Mau Mara Serengeti Sustainable Water Initiative". Web-based scenario development for rangeland management. Funded by the Dutch Embassy in Kenya. (project coordinator and researcher)

Teaching (see links below)
- Elective Participatory Planning I (techniques) and II (processes): Scenario Development, Spatial Planning Support Systems and Collaborative Decision Support  (1 quartile) 
- Problem-Based Learning in Spatial Engineering program teaching topics on wicked problems, systems analysis, policy analysis, and changing value chains (1 quartile) 
- Distance course Spatial Decision Support Systems in https://cartographymaster.eu/ (10 weeks part-time)

Consulting projects
2012 - 2020: Development of Spatial Development Framework Methods for UN-Habitat in Sudan (Darfur region & Blue Nile state), Rwanda, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Lesotho.

PhD supervision: 
Egypt: Settlement growth analysis with Machine Learning. 
UK: Uncertainty, climate change and consequent risk in forest planning and management
China: Planning support for industrial restructuring in the city of Shenzhen

EU projects (INTERREG & FP7): 
- CHANGES: "Changing Hydro-meteorological Risks". Funded by FP7 (http://www.changes-itn.eu/)
- INCREO: "Increasing Resilience through Earth Observation". Funded by FP7 (http://www.increo-fp7.eu/)
- FORESTCLIM: "Transnational Forestry Management Strategies in Response to Regional Climate Change Impacts“ (http://forestclim.eu/)
EO2HEAVEN: "Earth Observation and Environmental Modelling for the Mitigation of Health Risks" (http://www.eo2heaven.org/)
SAFELAND: "Living with landslide risk in Europe"
